intro: Canthium acuminatum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Canthium acuminatum is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
